description:
This is the first Lean Startup Circle Brussels meeting. You can consider it a board meeting, and you are welcome to help us give it shape.  Tentative agenda:

30m Intro Lean Startup  30m Startup testimonies (2-3 start-ups sharing their experiences with lean startup and customer development) 30m Open discussion: Lean Startup Circle Brussels Pizza + Glühwein + Christmas sweets   

We are grateful to our sponsors: Betagroup Coworking Brussels,  ICAB Business & Technology Incubator and Sirris.
name: Lean Startup Circle - Glühwein Edition

description:
Hi 

It's time for our next meetup. 

Based on the discussion we had, the topic will  focus on customer interviews. Who to contact? How to contact? What to ask (interview script)? Different rounds? How to process results? When to stop? Interviews vs. surveys. 

Suggested format (see this discussion):

1. 45m Plenary 

* 20m Curated overview of the topic 
* 20-30m 2 startups share their story/difficulties in front of the whole group (5m talk + 15m discussion)

2. 45m Working groups 
* We split into tables and discuss.

(Each startup speaker takes one table, speaker takes another, and other volunteers and I take other tables) 

3. 15m Short wrap-up

Retrospect on the event and the lessons learned (e.g. each table gets 2-3 minutes).

 

We are grateful to our sponsors:

* Betagroup Coworking Brussels

</a>* <a href="http://www.icabrussel.be/" target="_blank">ICAB Business & Technology Incubator 

* Sirris

</a>* <a href="http://www.financecoach24.com/">Finance Coach
name: #2 How to really talk to your customers

description:
Can you use landing pages for validated learning (experimenting, learning about customers, validating your business model...)? How?
What is the anatomy of an effective landing page? What tools can you use to set it up? What should you test? What should you measure?

Here's the agenda:

18:30 Food
19:00 Presentation / discussion 
20:00 1 startup case

20:30 DrinkA warm thanks to our ongoing sponsors - Beta Group co-working space, ICAB and Sirris! Thanks to them we have a roof over our head, and some food to eat ;-)
name: What is really a Landing Page and why should you care?

description:
Note: postponed because of the clash with Beta Group!

2 startups will get a chance for their most burning question to be discussed by all attendees (see below). Interested? E-mail me.

But as always, there is a topic: Metrics, schmetrics. What the heck is all that noise about??

Build, measure, learn. Actionable metrics vs. vanity metrics. Cohort analysis. Sorry, I may be simple, but can you speak English please?

I get the principle. We want to build products people love. We want to find a repeatable and scalable way to reach customers and make money. And metrics can help us measure if we are on the right track to achieve that. You can also talk to customers (and you should), but metrics are cool as you measure what customer do, not what they say.

I get that. But how do I get started? This will be the topic of discussion during our next Lean Startup Circle.

Here's the proposal for the agenda:

18:30 Food 19:00 Presentation / discussion on metrics, schmetrics (featuring our own expert Gilbert West!) 19:45 Break 20:00 2 startup cases 21:00 Drink Startup cases: we need 2 volunteers. The idea is the following:

3m   Startup presents their business model, and asks a question 15m Break down in groups, discussion on the case 10m Each group gets 2 minutes to present results from their discussion A warm thanks to our ongoing sponsors - Beta Group co-working space, ICAB and Sirris! Thanks to them we have a roof over our head, and some food to eat ;-)

See you in two weeks!

Vlad
name: Metrics, schmetrics. What the heck is all that noise about??

description:
How the heck do you put a price on a new product? Throw a dice? Pick a number?

How about scalable pricing: can you capture more of the revenue that your customers are willing to pay, without putting off smaller customers that are not able to pay high prices?

Let's come together and discuss this relevant topic.

We have a guest speaker, our very own successful Internet entrepreneur, Lars Peter Svane CEO, Sales & Marketing at EuroJobsites.

After an attempt at an e-Government startup, Lars co-founded the European Affairs Jobsite EuroBrussels.com in 2001. A company was created in 2003, and he left his daytime job in January 2006. EuroJobsites nows runs 5 freemium jobsites for scientists, engineers and economists and a community site for international lawyers.

A warm thanks to our ongoing sponsors - Beta Group co-working space, ICAB and Sirris! Thanks to them we have a roof over our head, and some food to eat ;-)

Best regards,

Vladimir

Grab our free business development course!

10 Steps to Growing a Scalable Business
how_to_find_us: Metro: Petillon Tram: Arsenal Train: Etterbeek Station Bus: 34, 95
name: Pricing for Startups

description:
We have three great guest speakers for the evening.

David Scheckel from the Treveri Market (US, Luxembourg).

David will talk about how to raise money in challenging market, passion and commitment needed to succeed, also about looking beyond borders to look for partnerships to reduce need for funds.

See more about David and his company below.

Leo Exter will speak from his experience with Beta Invest. He'll share practical tips on talking to investors – what really works and what really, really doesn’t.  Hands-on experience AND a close look from the outside

Vladimir Blagojevic and Martin Van Wunnik talking about their own experience with grant funding

Treveri Market connects investors to the best start ups and businesses globally and to help small and mid size companies get started, grow and partner in unique and productive ways.

David was previously CEO and Founder of an international equity order routing broker, held senior positions at Merrill Lynch, Herzog Heine Geduld, and Cowen and Company. David brings his extensive knowledge of exchanges, trading systems, programming and networks, as well as the drive to foster change in the capital formation process to enable more companies to succeed.

 

A warm thanks to our ongoing sponsors - Beta Group co-working space, ICAB and Sirris! Thanks to them we have a roof over our head, and some food to eat ;-)

Best regards,

Vladimir

name: Sales for startups

description:
Co-founder agreements, terms of service, disclaimers, IP and other stuff that we hate to deal with, but really really matters.

This is a difficult topic, and we appreciate expert input. A big thanks to Joren De Wachter for agreeing to help!

Joren is an independent IP strategist. He is qualified as a lawyer in civil and common law jurisdictions, and has extensive experience in working for international software businesses.

As one of the first actors in the field of IP strategy, he helps investors and businesses understand what their IP is, and how they can use it better in their business.

He focuses on software and IT, internet, content and new media.

www.jorendewachter.com

http://be.linkedin.com/in/jorendewachter

A warm thanks to our ongoing sponsors - Beta Group co-working space, ICAB and Sirris! Thanks to them we have a roof over our head, and some food to eat ;-)

Best regards,

Vladimir

Grab our free business development course!

10 Steps to Growing a Scalable Business
name: Legal for Startups

description:
Working on a new business? Great, this can be one of the most exciting experiences of your life.

Unfortunately, you are taking a risk. How do you know if your business succeed when so many new businesses fail?

And no, "I just need to finish building, and then I will sell" is not the correct answer.

In this session, I want to give you concrete tools to be able to quickly validate your business model.

You will also get some homework. And yes, I will follow up - remember - I want you to walk the walk.

So please don't join this session if you are not really serious about taking action.

venue.name: Betagroup Coworking Brussels / ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue des Pères Blancs, 1040 Etterbeek

name: (Free) Lean Startup Bootcamp 1: How to Quickly Validate Your Business Model

description:
(you'll need to bring your laptop for this one)

Do you already have a product, but are struggling with sales?

Join the club! :-)

This is probably the most difficult challenge every (startup) company faces.

I'll run this bootcamp with Omar Mohout, a successful serial entrepreneur and a go-to-market specialist.

Here is what we'll do:
1. Path to customers: Omar will share his experiences with different marketing channels - what worked well, and what didn't
2. Sales argumentation: I'll give you a practical blueprint to build your sales argumentation
3. *You* will then get to work on your own channels and your sales argumentation and get feedback on it

Like with the previous bootcamp, you'll get some homework, and we'll follow up on it. Again, please don't come if you just want to listen.

venue.name: Betagroup Coworking Brussels / ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue des Pères Blancs, 1040 Etterbeek

name: (Free) Go-to-Market Bootcamp 2: Towards a Successful Sales Machine

description:
Navigating the unique challenges and opportunities when creating Lean Startups in established high tech companies, corporate and even government environments:

18:30 food/drinks 19:00 – 21:00 Presentations and Q&A Jeanne Goldie of 52WeekTurnaround and Carl Danneels of Plethon and will share their expertise on how to navigate the special challenges, responsibilities and politics when working in an existing corporate or government structure. Understand how to apply the Lean model, communicate the vision, measure and valuate results while managing the politics of Intrapreneurship. Please join us for this informative session.

Big thanks to our sponsors from Impulse Brussels and the Software.Brussels Cluster.

venue.name: Impulse Brussels (Tour & Taxis) - Free parking!
venue.address_1: Avenue du Port 86C, B211- 1000 Brussels, Brussels

name: Lean Startup Intrapreneurs: can established companies innovate like startups?

description:
Dear members, 

Carl Danneels and I have worked on a brand new series of meetups to feed you with the best startup insights. Each meetup will be a unique experience. They will be conceived to discuss startup methodologies, consolidate our ecosystem and share our experiences. Here’s the first meetup of this series:

“What are the most useful things to a startup?”

- Format: a collective workshop to determine our top 10 list
- Take aways: ideas to apply to your startup and a collective checklist
- Venue: 1st October 2014, 7pm at Miamstramgram café (469 ch. de Boondael, 1050 Brussels)

Save the date, the detailed program is coming!

Olivier Colot
Co-organizer of the Lean Startup Circle

P.-S. Ice bucket challenges allowed.
P.-P.-S. Carl loves lemon in his ice water.
name: What are the most useful things to a startup?
